abstract.text: An interface that enables SwiftData to manage a Swift class as a stored model.

abstract.text: Write your model code declaratively to add managed persistence and efficient
model fetching.
A type that describes the configuration of an app’s schema or specific group of models.
Creates a model container using the specified schema, migration plan, and
configurations.
Creates a model container using the specified model types, migration plan, and
zero or more configurations.
Creates a model container using the specified schema, migration plan, and zero
or more configurations.
A type that describes the aggregate identity of a SwiftData model.
An interface that enables SwiftData to manage a Swift class as a stored model.
Restricted-use symbols that the framework requires for macro expansion and
other internal tasks.
Describe your model classes to SwiftData using the framework’s macros, and
store instances of those models so they exist beyond the app’s runtime.

doc://com.apple.SwiftData/documentation/.title: Preserving your app’s model data across launches

abstract.text: An object that maps model classes to data in the model store, and helps with the migration of that data
between releases.
An interface for describing the evolution of a schema and how to migrate between specific versions.
A type that emits notifications to observers when underlying data changes.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A class of types whose instances hold the value of an entity with stable identity.
